intro: Zephyranthes aurantiaca, commonly known as the pink hurricane lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and orange. The plant produces a tall, slender stem that bears several flowers, which bloom in late summer and early fall. Zephyranthes aurantiaca is a bulbous perennial that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in sandy or coastal areas. It is also known for its ability to naturalize and spread through seed dispersal by wind and animals.
